ai-vb7:1.1_0: The four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
ai-vb7:1.2_0: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body internally ...
ai-vb7:2.2_0: It’s when a mendicant examines their own body up from the soles of the feet and down from the tips of the hairs, wrapped in skin and full of many kinds of filth.
ai-vb7:2.3_0: “In this body there is head hair, body hair, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, bones, bone marrow, kidneys, heart, liver, diaphragm, spleen, lungs, intestines, mesentery, undigested food, feces, bile, phlegm, pus, blood, sweat, fat, tears, grease, saliva, synovial fluid, urine.”
ai-vb7:2.4_0: He practices, develops, makes much of that sign, and fixes its definition...
ai-vb7:2.5_0: He makes much of that sign, and fixes the body external shield, wore out and fixes his mind on the body.
ai-vb7:3.1_0: And how does a monk dwell contemplating (the nature of) the body in the body in regard to another?
ai-vb7:3.2_0: It’s when a mendicant examines their own body up from the soles of the feet and down from the tips of the hairs, wrapped in skin and full of many kinds of filth.
ai-vb7:3.3_0: “There is head hair, body hair, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, bones, bone marrow, kidneys, heart, liver, diaphragm, spleen, lungs, intestines, mesentery, undigested food, feces, bile, phlegm, pus, blood, sweat, fat, tears, grease, saliva, snot, synovial fluid, urine.”
ai-vb7:3.4_0: He practices, develops, makes much of that sign, and fixes its definition...
ai-vb7:3.5_0: He makes much of that sign, and fixes the sign, and continue to readily.

ai-vb7:4.4_0: That’s how a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body internally and externally—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-vb7:5.3_0: It’s the wisdom there is from understanding that thoughts ...
ai-vb7:5.5_0: With this contemplation he is endowed, endowed, truly endowed, having attained, truly attained,

ai-vb7:7.4_0: This is said to be the best.

ai-vb7:9.3_0: And that’s when mindfulness of breathing is mindfulness.
ai-vb7:9.5_0: With this mindfulness he is endowed, endowed, truly endowed, having attained, truly attained,
ai-vb7:9.6_0: Therefore it is said to be “wareless”.
ai-vb7:10.1_0: “Consciousness is a desire and aversion for the world.”
ai-vb7:10.3_0: the world is like a body.
ai-vb7:10.4_0: as the world of the five constituents (of mind and body) that provide fuel for attachment.
ai-vb7:10.8_0: this is said to be “who has covetousness.”
ai-vb7:10.10_0: Mental pain, mental displeasure, the painful, unpleasant feeling that’s born from mental contact.
ai-vb7:10.12_0: Thus this avarice and this sorrow are removed from the world, expelled, educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired. These are eliminated, released, unaffected, and understanding.
ai-vb7:10.13_0: Because of this “after removing avarice and sorrow regarding the world.”
ai-vb7:12.1_0: And how does a monk dwell contemplating (the nature of) the feelings in the feelings in regard to himself?
ai-vb7:12.2_0: When a mendicant feels a pleasant feeling, they know: “I feel a pleasant feeling.” When they feel a painful feeling, they know: “I feel a neutral feeling.” When they feel a spiritual pleasant feeling, they know: “I feel a neutral feeling, I feel a painful feeling, or neutral feeling.”
ai-vb7:12.3_0: He practices, develops, makes much of that sign, and fixes its definition...
ai-vb7:12.4_0: He makes much of that sign, and continue to make much of that sign, then his mind draws back from the out.
ai-vb7:13.1_0: And how does a monk dwell contemplating (the nature of) the feelings in the feelings in regard to another?
ai-vb7:13.2_0: It’s when a mendicant who feels a pleasant feeling knows that it feels, and when they feel a neutral feeling, they understand that it’s when they feel a neutral feeling, they understand that they feel a spiritual pleasant feeling, or neutral feeling.
ai-vb7:13.3_0: He practices, develops, makes much of that sign, and fixes its definition...
ai-vb7:13.4_0: He makes much of that sign, and fixes the mind on to that sign, and then apprehends it over his mind in requested his mind; then he focuses his mind on his own and on another.

ai-vb7:18.2_0: Here a monk when his mind is concentrated he knows “his mind is free from greed,” or, “his mind is free from greed, hate, and delusion”; or, “This is free from delusion”;
ai-vb7:18.3_0: He practices, develops, makes much of that sign, and fixes its definition...
ai-vb7:18.4_0: He makes much of that sign, and fixes the mind on to that sign, and fixing it aside.
ai-vb7:19.1_0: And how does a monk dwell contemplating (the nature of) the mind in the mind in regard to himself and in regard to another?
ai-vb7:19.2_0: Here a monk when a mind is without passion knows “the mind is freed mind”; or when it is immersed in samādhi he knows “the mind is without greed, hate, or delusion”; or, when a mind is immersed in samādhi, he knows “the mind is freed”; or “the mind is not immersed in samādhi”;
ai-vb7:19.3_0: That’s how a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the mind internally and externally—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

ai-vb7:22.1_0: And how does a monk dwell contemplating (the nature of) things in (various) things in regard to himself?
ai-vb7:22.2_0: It’s when a mendicant who has sensual desire in them understands: “I have sensual desire in me.” When they don’t have sensual desire in them, they understand how sensual desire arises; how, when it’s already arisen, it’s given up; and how, once it’s given up, it doesn’t arise again in the future.
ai-vb7:22.3_0: When there’s ill will in himself
ai-vb7:22.6_0: When they have doubt in them, they understand: “I have doubt in me.” When they don’t have doubt in them, they understand: ‘I don’t have doubt in me.’ They understand how doubt arises; how, when it’s already arisen, it’s given up; and how, once it’s given up, it doesn’t arise again in the future.
ai-vb7:23.1_0: When they have the awakening factor of mindfulness in them, they understand: “I have the awakening factor of mindfulness in me.” When they don’t have the awakening factor of mindfulness in them, they understand: ‘I don’t have the awakening factor of mindfulness in me.’ They understand how the awakening factor of mindfulness that has not arisen comes to arise; or, when it’s already arisen, it’s fulfilled by development.
ai-vb7:23.3_0: When there’s the awakening factor of rapture ...
ai-vb7:23.6_0: equanimity in them, they understand: “I have the awakening factor of equanimity in me.” When they don’t have the awakening factor of equanimity in them, they understand: ‘I don’t have the awakening factor of equanimity in me.’ They understand how the awakening factor of equanimity that has not arisen comes to arise; and how the awakening factor of equanimity that has arisen becomes fulfilled by development.

ai-vb7:48.1_0: The four kinds of mindfulness meditation.

ai-vb7:49.1_0: Are the four kinds of mindfulness meditation? Are any unskillful intentions?
ai-vb7:50.2_0: they may be connected with pleasant feeling.
ai-vb7:50.3_0: they may be things that have resultant nature.
ai-vb7:50.4_0: not attached to (but) are favourable to the attachments,
ai-vb7:50.5_0: (They are) not connected with the defilements.
ai-vb7:50.6_0: they may be without thinking, with thinking and reflection, without placing the mind and keeping it connected.
ai-vb7:50.7_0: they may be united with joy, and having happiness.
ai-vb7:50.8_0: (They are) not given up through vision (of the First Path).
ai-vb7:50.9_0: (They have) roots that are neither to be given up through vision (of the First Path) nor through development (of the rest of the Paths).
ai-vb7:50.15_0: they may be fixed in righteousness.
ai-vb7:50.16_0: They might not have Path as their objects, or have a different path that they will be described in the way that is proper for root, or that they will be described.
ai-vb7:50.18_0: they may be in the past, future, or present.
ai-vb7:50.19_0: Also they are not to be spoken of as object, they say, “The object is including the object” and “They are not.”
ai-vb7:50.20_0: they may be internal and external.
ai-vb7:50.22_0: (They are) not visible and without impingement.
ai-vb7:51.4_0: (They are) not to be spoken of as roots and connected with roots, but are not roots.
ai-vb7:51.5_0: (They are) not to be spoken of as roots and associated with roots, but are not rooted in the same way.
ai-vb7:51.6_0: (They are) not roots but are connected with roots.
ai-vb7:52.7_0: some are not perceptible in another way.
ai-vb7:52.11_0: (They are) not to be spoken of as Sāketa and mindful, but not defilements.
ai-vb7:52.12_0: (They are) not to be spoken of as associated with pollutants, but not defilements.
ai-vb7:52.30_0: (They are) productions that are produced by mind and developed by mind.
ai-vb7:52.31_0: (They are) productions that are produced by mind and kept rolling by mind.
ai-vb7:52.37_0: (They are) not given up through vision (of the First Path).
ai-vb7:52.38_0: (They have) roots that are not to be given up through vision (of the First Path).
ai-vb7:52.39_0: (They have) roots that are not to be given up through development (of the rest of the Paths).
ai-vb7:53.3_0: They may be connected with joyful interest,
ai-vb7:53.4_0: they may be united with joyful interest.
ai-vb7:53.5_0: they may be united with pleasure,
ai-vb7:53.6_0: they may be united with equanimity.
ai-vb7:53.7_0: (They are) not (connected with) the sensual realms.
ai-vb7:53.8_0: (They are) not (connected with) the formless realms.
